@guozhangwang @hachikuji addressed comments on names. Went with Jason's suggestion to split the function into two -- we actually had one half of it anyway.
@guozhangwang  Please review again. Thanks.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/4767/
Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

I can confirm this patch is working, thanks for the quick fix!

Is it possible to also apply this patch to 0.10.2.2?

Maybe my example can be used to make an (integration) test for fix. Without the fix there are 850 open file handles after 5 minutes and with the fix it's only 70.
cc @hachikuji @guozhangwang

retest this please

My biggest problem with this patch is that I have no idea how to test the KafkaApis changes. Even with an integration test, the only effect of `OPERATION_NOT_ATTEMPTED` is that the client logs a message. So I really don't know how we can meaningfully test it. Suggestions welcome!
Merging to trunk and 0.11.0
@ijuma Thanks. The suggested improvements look good to me.

@apurvam, thanks for the PR. We typically test things like this by writing tests that exercise the protocol directly. For example, `FetchRequestTest`. A more recent option (with pros and cons) is `KafkaApisTest`, which relies on mocks to make the test much faster.
@dguy, is this OK?

@mjsax @guozhangwang take a look please.

@vahidhashemian, if you have time, it would be good to do a follow-up PR that fixes the deprecation warnings that can be fixed:

1. Uses of the old consumers in tools and tests where the new consumer would work as well (or better).
2. Methods in `ClientUtils` that are called by server or tools code should be introduced in `AdminUtils` with the implementation living in `AdminUtils`. All the existing callers apart from the old clients should call the `AdminUtils` methods.

Thanks.
